metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1552 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in PostgreSQL. There is an issue with incomplete efforts to operate safely when a privileged user is maintaining another user's objects. The Autovacuum, REINDEX, CREATE INDEX, REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW, CLUSTER, and pg_amcheck commands activated relevant protections too late or not at all during the process. This flaw allows an attacker with permission to create non-temporary objects in at least one schema to execute arbitrary SQL functions under a superuser identity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libecpg6 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpq5 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-14 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-client-14 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plperl-14 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-14 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-14 - 14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-14 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
